alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 26 at 12:04PM PST until December 27 at 7:31AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Stillaguamish River At Arlington affecting Snohomish County. .The combination of ice and snow melt along with a series of wet weather systems passing through the area will result in river levels on the Stillaguamish rising through the afternoon. This will be enough to push levels above flood stage this afternoon and tonight.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. WAC061-270415- /O.NEW.KSEW.FL.W.0078.221226T2155Z-221227T1531Z/ /ARLW1.1.ER.221226T2155Z.221227T0000Z.221227T0330Z.NO/ 1204 PM PST Mon Dec 26 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillaguamish River at Arlington. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, the Stillaguamish River will locally spill over its banks. Minor flooding around Silvana will occur... including over Pioneer Highway. A stage of 14 feet on the Stillaguamish River corresponds roughly to Phase 2 in the Snohomish County Flood program. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:40 AM PST Monday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 15.3 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tonight to 10.5 feet. Additional rises will be possible as another wet frontal system moves through the area Tuesday. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
